text: I think the first movie that Americans

ninis this is I think the first time
that we had seen this in America and it
I'm curious that that you that's the
cockney is your company is my natural
dialect your company yes I mean this
isn't it this is just a general London
accent if I spoke cockney you wouldn't
know what the hell I was talking about
but it interests me that that among the
other great actors of your generation
say Roger Moore and Connery to an extent
O'Toole they all kind of adapted or you
know a kind of a more posh accent you
have stuck with this yeah that was
deliberate on my part I'm very I was
always very aware of the class in the
class in you know system in England and
so I'd when I became a success I sort of
shoved it down their throat and continue
to talk like I did do good and it was to
encourage other people from working
class backgrounds to say that they could
do it because very difficult to explain
to an American a social system where you
have to remember when I grew up every
actor talked posh all plays and movies
were about middle-class or upper-class
things you know it was all bunty's
having a party let's go up to London and
everyone was in tennis shorts and
rackets and I came to a place where
everybody's get beaten to death by
gangsters and they've crap everywhere
you know and so it was you never thought
of being an actor because you didn't
first of all he didn't talk properly
everybody said that to me you know you
didn't talk properly but I kept the
accent in the hope that it would sort of
break down the class barrier and say to
young people like myself you can do it
you don't have to be an actor anything
you can do it doesn't matter how you
speak
